One or more ranges of cells that you designate to print when you don't want to print the entire worksheet. If a worksheet includes a print area, only the print area is printed.
To make a change to an existing file or document.
A paper size of 95.25mm x 171.45 mm.
An electronic funds transfer system available in the European Union that permits a payer to transfer funds from their bank account to a payee's bank account.
A new type of ScreenTip that is larger and can contain more detailed information, including graphics.
A new type of ScreenTip that is larger and can contain more detailed information, including graphics.
A subqueue of the application queue where poison messages get moved to be later processed by a poison-message handling application.
To collect the funds for a check and pay them to the check holder. When a check clears, the money has been withdrawn from the bank account and paid to the recipient.
Of, pertaining to, or characterized by non-capital letters.
Information stored in the prologue of an XML document. This information is passed through the XML parser to any application that uses the XML document.
A button on Phone Controls that places the current phone call on hold.
The condition of a user that can be displayed to the user's contacts to communicate whether the user is currently online and available, offline and unavailable, and so on.
A proprietary protocol to provide remote display and input capabilities over network connections for Windows®-based applications between two computers.
A proprietary protocol to provide remote display and input capabilities over network connections for Windows®-based applications between two computers.
Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of an action or operation that takes place based on whether or not a certain condition is true.

Application software that gathers data from the user, prepares it for the server, and issues a request to the server. The client presents data received from the server to the user through its own user interface.
An item in the Exchange store that represents an appointment, a meeting, a meeting request, or an event. It can identify the place, resources, recurrence, and attendees involved at a discrete time.
A permission setting that permits a person or domain to add the user to contact lists, see the user's status, or send instant messages to the user.
To put into use.
A UI element that ends a user session or exits a service.
To plan, allocate, and send out technicians, spare parts, and special equipment to solve a service problem.
The person in charge of managing a computer. The administrator is responsible for installing software, assigning passwords, and managing files.
The person in charge of managing a computer. The administrator is responsible for installing software, assigning passwords, and managing files.
The stylistic attributes of a font — such as bold, italic, and underline.
An agreement between two parties for the sale of goods or services.

A type of managed folder that is created by an Exchange administrator and placed in a user’s mailbox for messaging records management (MRM) purposes. The retention and journaling of messages in managed custom folders are controlled by managed content settings that are applied to the folder.
A list of users, accounts, Web sites, etc. that are permitted to perform certain actions on a network.
A list of users, accounts, Web sites, etc. that are permitted to perform certain actions on a network.
A slide template that defines default formatting or the position of placeholders for one or more slides in a presentation.
An operating unit whose managers are accountable for budgeted and actual expenditures.
The set of rules on a computer and a portable device that allow digital media files and other information to be synchronized.
A context menu that enables the user to preview the contents of a file with the Office Preview Handler (OPH) in Outlook (either documents attached to email or SharePoint documents in Outlook).

The primary access protocol for Active Directory. LDAP is an industry-standard protocol, established by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), that allows users to query and update information in a directory service. Active Directory supports both LDAP version 2 and LDAP version 3.

The primary access protocol for Active Directory. LDAP is an industry-standard protocol, established by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF), that allows users to query and update information in a directory service. Active Directory supports both LDAP version 2 and LDAP version 3.
A filter effect in Windows Movie Maker.

Adds preset visual effects to text on slides. Ranging from subtle to exciting, each scheme usually includes an effect for the slide title and an effect that is applied to bullets or paragraphs on a slide.
A brief content of a larger document.
A standard system control that initiates a command.
A standard system control that initiates a command.
A feature in Windows that allows users to access and manage printers, multi-function printers, digital cameras and scanners.
To prevent another user from initiating a conversation and from viewing your presence or other information, such as your personal information.
The list of answers to a search request that match the search criteria specified by the user.

The part of an agreement that defines the business process that is used, your role, your partner's role, and the policies or parameters that are used in that relationship along with documentation, such as a list of business and legal terms.
A list in which each item or block of text is preceded by a bullet.
A temporary storage place for deleted files. The user can use it to retrieve files deleted in error. These deleted files are not actually removed from the hard disk until the recycle bin is emptied.

A list of domain names and e-mail addresses that you want to receive messages from. E-mail addresses in Contacts and in the Global Address Book are included in this list by default. People you sent messages to will be added to the list.
A field size or data type that can hold positive integer numbers ranging from 0 to 255.

An application that runs on a Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) managed device. The agent application is the object of management activities. A computer running SNMP agent software is also sometimes referred to as an agent.

The normal or ideal cost that is used as a comparison to the actual cost. For manufactured items, standard cost price includes labor, materials, and overhead. For purchased items, standard cost price includes purchase price plus transportation and other fees.
An optical storage medium for digital data.
An optical storage medium for digital data.

A software component that represents a logical path between a source and a destination for the purpose of transmitting Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) messages. A SMTP connector can be configured as a Send connector or as a Receive connector.
A personal or work-related project, assignment, or errand to be tracked through to completion.
A personal or work-related project, assignment, or errand to be tracked through to completion.
A secondary window that allows users to perform a command, asks users a question, or provides users with information or progress feedback.
A block of two or more cells in a spreadsheet.
A rectangular area on a computer screen in which programs and content appear.
The number of video frames displayed per second. Higher frame rates generally produce smoother movement in the picture.
The number of video frames displayed per second. Higher frame rates generally produce smoother movement in the picture.
The number of video frames displayed per second. Higher frame rates generally produce smoother movement in the picture.
A tool that automates security best practices to reduce the attack surface for a server. The SCW was introduced with Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 1.
A tool that automates security best practices to reduce the attack surface for a server. The SCW was introduced with Windows Server 2003 Service Pack 1.
To add a database, either a blank database or a copy of the production database, to the storage group copy. This becomes the baseline database for the passive copy of the storage group.

The recognizer specific part of the shape trainer. Typically every recognizer claiming to support shape personalization must supply a Shape Client DLL. All the Microsoft Latin recognizers will all use the same Shape Client.
A network status that indicates a client is not connected to a server.
The { character.
A small x or other sign that appears in the check box if the option represented by the box is selected.
A method used for determining the order in which goods should be taken out of inventory, so that items with the earliest expiration dates are taken first.
A method used for determining the order in which goods should be taken out of inventory, so that items with the earliest expiration dates are taken first.
To retrieve a writable copy of a file or project from a source repository. This locks the file for editing to prevent others from overwriting or editing it inadvertently.
A floating task pane that allows users to view and customize specific paragraph and text style properties.
A file format that can be viewed using a Web browser. With this file format, you can publish your reports directly to your Intranet or web site.
Add-in software that provides partially localized user interfaces for particular computer programs in languages not supported by localized versions of those programs.
Add-in software that provides partially localized user interfaces for particular computer programs in languages not supported by localized versions of those programs.
A third-party software developer; an individual or an organization that independently creates computer software.
A third-party software developer; an individual or an organization that independently creates computer software.
A cookie that is deleted at the end of the browser session.

A folder on a public server that people can use to share information, such as work information, discussions, contacts, tasks, and classified ads. Access permissions determine who can view and alter the folder and to what extent.
A number that is not a whole number, such as ½ (vulgar fraction) or 0.5 (decimal fraction), formed by dividing one quantity into another.
A file containing digitized audio, such as voice or music.

A startup process that begins with turning on the computer's power. Typically, a cold boot involves some basic hardware checking by the system, after which the operating system is loaded from disk into memory.
The command interpreter that is used to pass commands to the operating system.

The device on which images generated by the computer's video adapter are displayed. The term monitor usually refers to a video display and its housing. The monitor is attached to the video adapter by a cable.

A group of one or more COM objects in a process. A COM object lives in exactly one apartment, in the sense that its methods can legally be directly called only by a thread that belongs to that apartment. Any other thread that wants to call the object must go through a proxy.
A list of the user's actions within a program, such as commands entered in an operating system shell, menus passed through using Gopher, or links followed using a Web browser.
An index entry that falls under a more general heading. For example, the index entry "planets" could have the subentries "Mars" and "Venus."

Related data points that are plotted in a chart. Each data series in a chart has a unique color or pattern and is represented in the chart legend. You can plot one or more data series in a chart. Pie charts have only one data series.
A view of a document as it will appear on the printed page.
Colors that are directly next to each other on the color wheel. Each color has two analogous colors (one on each side of it).
A detailed set of instructions that describes how to create a particular item.
The date on which something ceases to be effective.
The temporary treatment of the costs of hours, items, and expenses as capital until the revenue is posted.

A fixed-disk file system that organizes the disk into volumes, rather than partitions and logical drives. HPFS supports long, mixed-case filenames and extended attributes, and implements several levels of caching, for improved operating-system performance. The IBM OS/2 operating system supports HPFS.
A disk directory in which an SMTP service can deposit incoming mail messages.
A group in the data source that can occur more than once. Controls such as repeating sections and repeating tables are bound to repeating groups.
The quantity of items for which a price is set.

A data type that stores a signed, exact numeric value described as the number of digits appearing before and after the decimal point, with a maximum of 29 total digits. All possible digits cannot be represented if you are using the maximum number of digits.
The process of rewriting parts of a file to contiguous sectors on a hard disk to increase the speed of access and retrieval.
The blank area between two or more columns of text or between two facing pages in a publication.
In a 2-D chart, the area bounded by the axes, including all data series. In a 3-D chart, the area bounded by the axes, including the data series, category names, tick-mark labels, and axis titles.

A small piece of code that can be transported over the Internet and executed on the recipient's machine. The term is especially used to refer to such programs as they are embedded in line as objects in HTML documents on the World Wide Web.
A viewer that allows users to visualize, navigate, and customize the view of files with an XPS Document format.
A quotation that competes with other quotations for the same good or service and is linked to a primary quotation.
A group of European countries/regions (including Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland) that have agreed to free trade among themselves.
A group of European countries/regions (including Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland) that have agreed to free trade among themselves.

A collection of recipient and other Active Directory objects. Each address list can contain one or more types of objects (for example, users, contacts, groups, public folders, conferencing, and other resources).
The date a customer or vendor requests that goods be received.
An order that consists of multiple items.
The alternate calendar that is selected from within Outlook. The secondary calendar appears when dual calendar support is enabled.

A software package that replaces an existing version of a product with a newer and/or more powerful or sophisticated version of the same product. The upgrade process typically leaves existing customer data and preferences intact while replacing the existing software with the newer version.

A software package that replaces an existing version of a product with a newer and/or more powerful or sophisticated version of the same product. The upgrade process typically leaves existing customer data and preferences intact while replacing the existing software with the newer version.
The bill that an organization gives a customer in connection with a sale.
The condition of a field, record, recordset, or database that makes it read-only to all users except the user currently modifying it.
The rules governing the formation of a command-line statement, including the order in which a command must be typed, and the elements that follow the command.
A query (SQL statement) that creates a new table and then creates records (rows) in it by copying records from an existing table.
A persistent queue that is used to hold messages that are submitted to the Exchange Server organization through SMTP-receive, the Pickup directory, or the store driver.
Audio, video, images, text, or any other information that is contained in a digital media file or stream.

A set of components and services that enable users to access their Exchange mailboxes through the application Outlook Web Access and the protocols Exchange ActiveSync, Post Office Protocol version 3 (POP3), and Internet Message Access Protocol 4rev1 (IMAP4). The Client Access server role also includes Web services that are used by other Exchange 2007 server roles.
To apply an identification marker to an item, case, or pallet.
A window that you can display when a data access page is open in Design view.
A combination of identifiers, which together define Internet Protocol security (IPsec), that protects communication between sender and receiver.
A label that is printed with a recipient's address and is used to mail or ship an item.
A label that is printed with a recipient's address and is used to mail or ship an item.
An external project that is invoiced as work progresses based on the consumption of hours, expenses, items, fees, and on-account transactions.

The basic element that holds information in Outlook (similar to a file in other programs). Items include e-mail messages, appointments, contacts, tasks, journal entries, notes, posted items, and documents.

The basic element that holds information in Outlook (similar to a file in other programs). Items include e-mail messages, appointments, contacts, tasks, journal entries, notes, posted items, and documents.
In operation; operating, working.
In a mail-merge operation, the document that contains the text and graphics that are the same for each version of the merged document, for example, the return address or salutation in a form letter.
The structure or organization of data in a file.
The structure or organization of data in a file.
A feature of Windows that defines and manages a standard format for application setup and installation, and tracks components such as groups of files, registry entries, and shortcuts.
The time period during which a product or service will remain functional before the user or customer must license, register, renew, or otherwise (re)activate their product or subscription.
An organization with more than 1000 employees and more than 500 personal computers.
An organization with more than 1000 employees and more than 500 personal computers.
Text that does not display in the normal view of a document's content.
The default name for a group of contacts created by the user.
A feature that allows users to see and interact with E-mail messages and their attachments side by side in the reading pane.
A page that presents a categorical view of select Help content that the user can browse. Depending on the edition, multiple How Do I pages might be available for use.
A filter effect in Windows Movie Maker.

A font display technology that dramatically improves font display resolution so that letters on the computer screen appear smooth, not jagged. ClearType dramatically improves the readability of text on color LCD monitors with a digital interface, such as those found in laptops and high-quality flat-panel desktop displays.
The process of identifying the components, and their quantities, that are required to produce an item.
The process of identifying the components, and their quantities, that are required to produce an item.
A space that is used to prevent multiple words from breaking if they fall at the end of a line.
A domain controller that has been assigned one or more special roles in an Active Directory domain.

A fundamental data type that holds double-precision floating-point numbers. It's stored as a 64-bit number ranging in value from approximately -1.797E308 to -4.940E-324 (negative), from 4.94E-324 to 1.797E308 (positive), and 0.
Pertaining to the state of a phone line when it is in use.
A prediction of future events, such as income, sales, or weather.

A precompiled collection of SQL statements and optional control-of-flow statements stored under a name and processed as a unit. They are stored in an SQL database and can be run with one call from an application.

A worksheet view that displays the areas to be printed and the locations of page breaks. The area to be printed is displayed in white, automatic page breaks appear as dashed lines, and manual page breaks appear as solid lines.
A set of software functionality designed to solve a specific problem or to provide a new functionality to the user.
A field that stores hyperlink addresses.
Files that are used to help detect harmful or unwanted software and to prevent it from installing or running on your computer.

A button on the message toolbar that compares the names in the To, Cc, and Bcc boxes against the names in the Address Book and against those contact folders that you've specified as Outlook Address Books.

A filtering list that is used by the Connection Filter agent in Exchange Server 2007. IP addresses on the IP Block list are considered spam. Messages originating from an IP address that is on the IP Block list are stopped from entering the Exchange organization.

A user interface element that provides users with a quick and easy way to navigate across a large group of opened Web pages by providing the user with a visual representation of all of the opened thumbnails. Through this visualization, the user can easily spot and select a desired thumbnail.
A cost that varies based on production or sales volume.
A "container" for a set of separate files (or subdocuments). You can use a master document to set up and manage a multipart document, such as a book with several chapters.

A string that is used to identify a user or entity to an operating system, directory service, or distributed system. For example, in Windows® integrated authentication, a login name uses the form "DOMAIN\username."
A type of column that displays the results of mathematical or logical operations or expressions instead of stored data.
An audio CD that contains both audio and other multimedia content.
The speed at which binary digits are transmitted.
An item on the user's My Status menu that can be selected while signed in to make it appear to other users that he or she is currently away.
The maximum amount on a purchase request document that an approver is allowed to approve.
To change a program in order to be able to run it on a different computer.
A feature that allows you to set up your computer so that when you insert a CD or DVD, it will play automatically and you won't have to select your preferences every time.
A list in which each item or block of text is preceded by a number.

A document area that contains a range of text distinct from other areas of text in a document. For example, if a document includes body text, footnotes, and headers, it contains a main text story, footnotes story, and headers story.

An authentication method that prompts the user for a user name and a password, also called credentials, which are hashed with other data before being transmitted over the network. Digest authentication is available only on domains that have domain controllers that are running Microsoft Windows Server operating systems.
Personal configurations of a program or operating system.
The – character, based on the width of an uppercase N and used primarily as a connecting element, especially with numbers.
The – character, based on the width of an uppercase N and used primarily as a connecting element, especially with numbers.
A text file containing code to apply semantics such as page layout specifications to published content.
A vertical area along the left edge of the document window that displays the name of the paragraph style that is applied to each paragraph.
A 12-digit hexadecimal address that is preprogrammed into a computer's network adapter, and that uniquely identifies that computer on the network.
A serial communications port used to connect a device, such as a modem, printer, or mobile device, to a computer.
A serial communications port used to connect a device, such as a modem, printer, or mobile device, to a computer.
A serial communications port used to connect a device, such as a modem, printer, or mobile device, to a computer.
The formal name for Excel 12 file format. The Excel XML Format has an open, royalty-free specification, and is the technology licensed to external parties.

A type of object that has an e-mail address on a domain in the organization, but the object does not have a mailbox in the domain at which to receive messages. The object appears in the global address list, which allows other people in the organization to easily locate or send a message to that person, but the administrator does not need to manage an unnecessary mailbox. Contacts, users, and even folders can be mail-enabled.
A database object that stores data in records (rows) and fields (columns). The data is usually about a particular category of things, such as employees or orders.
A type of CD on which files can be copied, erased, and replaced.
A type of CD on which files can be copied, erased, and replaced.
A source document that documents an invitation to bid on supplying a quantity of product for a specified price and by a specified date.
A source document that documents an invitation to bid on supplying a quantity of product for a specified price and by a specified date.
A legal agreement between Microsoft and the user, with regard to the terms of use and transfer of software.
A division of a fiscal year that is reflected on financial statements.
A division of a fiscal year that is reflected on financial statements.
Work that is authorized for released orders.
For local area networks (LANs), a device that is connected to the network and is capable of communicating with other network devices.
A planning structure used to schedule budget fund allocations and expenditures.
A button on Audio Controls that mutes the user's microphone.
The † character.
An information structure that precedes and identifies the information that follows.
Used by Microsoft Exchange to identify, locate, and open a form.
A function of some Web browsers that allows users to surf and view multiple pages by loading Web sites into sections (or tabs) of one page, rather than multiple pages.
A notification bar warning the user about data that is blocked in the loaded file. Trust Bars can be for information only (non-actionable) or actionable.
Of or pertaining to documents, data, software, or hardware that existed prior to a certain time.
A character with a non-zero width.
A rectangular array of pixels applied to a visual object.
A common drop-down menu that includes general purpose commands for editing objects displayed within a window, such as Cut, Copy, and Paste.
In Task Manager, the current working set of a process, in kilobytes. The current working set is the number of pages currently resident in memory.
A title animation in Windows Movie Maker.
Any ink that you add to a file that is not recognized as handwriting.

A feature or add-in for Outlook that enables small business owners to list business contacts, accounts, and opportunities, and to perform several tasks related to managing and tracking information about the business.
The structure or appearance of a unit of data, such as a field, or text in a message body.
The structure or appearance of a unit of data, such as a field, or text in a message body.
A natural number, zero, or the negative of a natural number.
To transfer a copy of a file from a local computer to a remote computer by means of a modem or network.
In computer games, an additional score or points given for efficient play.

A type that references a method. Once a delegate is assigned a method, it behaves exactly like that method. Delegates are roughly similar to function pointers in C++; however, they are type-safe and secure.
The horizontal bar at the top of a column. You can click a column selector to select an entire column in the query design grid or the filter design grid.

A ledger account that records cash transactions for a particular bank or for cash held at the company. For some companies, a liquidity account records transactions in liquid investments that can be sold from day to day.
A character that is not found on your keyboard and must be inserted from within the software or by pressing a combination of keys on your keyboard.

The timestamp of the most recent modification of a Navision entity. The modified entries are retrieved from the Change Log. If the Last Modified Date/Time is older than the last synchronization time, then entities will not be synchronized. If The Last Modified Date/Time is more recent, the synchronization will be performed.

The timestamp of the most recent modification of a Navision entity. The modified entries are retrieved from the Change Log. If the Last Modified Date/Time is older than the last synchronization time, then entities will not be synchronized. If The Last Modified Date/Time is more recent, the synchronization will be performed.
A government unit or subdivision that imposes taxes within a state. A geographical area within a state can be taxed by several jurisdictions: town, county, and state.
The prefix that is used to access an outside line. In the United States, this prefix is typically 9.
To move files or data from one software product, format, or protocol, to another.
A graphical representation of either a character, a part of a character, or a sequence of characters.
The degree of precision and exactness with which one entity represents another.
For a computer system, to be in an inactive state, but not shut off. When the computer is switched back on, the desktop is restored exactly as it was.
An exchange rate that pegs one currency's value to another currency's value.
A measure of profitability that is calculated by using the formula: profit margin = net income before tax and interest / revenue. It can be expressed as a percentage or a number.
A member of a dimension whose value is calculated at run time by using an expression. Calculated member values can be derived from the values of other members.
A document that contains general release information and late changes. It is one of the deliverables leading to the release readiness approved milestone.
A method for determining a production schedule by beginning with the production start date and working forward to determine the production completion date.
A method for determining a production schedule by beginning with the production start date and working forward to determine the production completion date.

A secondary data source that is accessible to users who fill out forms offline. When a user is online, data from the data source is stored on the user’s computer so that it can appear in controls when the form is offline.
A field you can create. A custom field can be a blank, combination, or formula field.
A selection technique that involves dragging out a bounding outline (also referred to as a marquee) to define the selected objects.
To start or reset a computer by turning the power on, by pressing a reset button on the computer case, or by issuing a software command to restart.
To release an item, or items, from inventory.

The engine at the core of managed code execution. The runtime supplies managed code with services such as cross-language integration, code access security, object lifetime management, and debugging and profiling support.

The engine at the core of managed code execution. The runtime supplies managed code with services such as cross-language integration, code access security, object lifetime management, and debugging and profiling support.
A protocol that establishes the security association and shared keys necessary for computers to communicate by using Internet Protocol security (IPsec).
A protocol that establishes the security association and shared keys necessary for computers to communicate by using Internet Protocol security (IPsec).
To prevent the writing (recording) of information, usually on a disk.
The amount of funds in a bank account after adding all the deposits and subtracting all the withdrawals and charges.
An option that causes the device to vibrate instead of playing an audible notification or alert tone.
A filter effect in Windows Movie Maker.
A graphic element on a drawing that is associated with data.

A protocol using a challenge-response mechanism for authentication in which clients are able to verify their identities without sending a password to the server. It consists of three messages, commonly referred to as Type 1 (negotiation), Type 2 (challenge) and Type 3 (authentication).
One of four fields of an SCODE that indicates the system service responsible for the error. It consists of a unique number that is assigned to represent the error or warning.
An exchange rate that is frozen for the entire project period.
The minimum desired inventory level. Inventory is replenished when it reaches the minimum level so that on-hand inventory stays above the minimum.
A visual cue to indicate which formatting will be applied when you double-click: a left-aligned, centered, or right-aligned tab stop; a left indent; or left or right text wrapping.

Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of an electronic circuit or hardware grouping in which the configuration is determined by the physical interconnection of the components (as opposed to being programmable in software or alterable by a switch).

A specific book used to copy transactions entered for a value model to the specific depreciation book. Can be used when assets are acquired so that the acquisition transaction needs to be entered only once instead of for each value model and depreciation book.
A stored version of a document or web page.
A small, basic command, named in the form 'verb-noun' and implemented as a .Net class that derives from a base cmdlet class.
A list of the captions for pictures, charts, graphs, slides, or other illustrations in a document, along with the numbers of the pages the captions appear on.
To close a program or application.
To perform the basic mathematical operation of deducting something from something else.
A title animation in Windows Movie Maker.
The measurement of the area in front of and behind the subject that is in focus.
To calculate the number of days that customer and supplier accounts have been outstanding.
A collection of masters associated with a particular Visio drawing type, or template. By default, stencils that open with a template are docked on the left side of the drawing window.
A fundamental data type that holds large integers. A Long variable is stored as a 32-bit number ranging in value from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.
A group of posting accounts that show the amounts customers owe for services or sales made on credit.

The feature in Internet Explorer that remembers the information you have typed into the Address bar, web forms, or password fields, and which automatically fills in that information if you start to type the same thing again later.
A classification of customers that share key characteristics.
The manipulation of data to transform it into some desired result.
A search operation that finds a desired string or record located anywhere in an application, document, or set of files.
A mechanism for moving data from one point to another.
Text or graphics inserted in a document when Microsoft Word carries out a field's instructions. When you print the document or hide field codes, the field results replace the field codes.
Revenue earned in one accounting period but received in a subsequent accounting period.
A quantity of time or materials maintained in the work flow as a cushion against fluctuations in throughput.
An order that has not yet been posted to the ledger.
Pertaining to text that is aligned along the left margin.
A unique name that identifies a user account to operating system. An account's user name must be unique among the other group names and user names within its own domain or workgroup.

A drop-down list box control on a data access page that retrieves records from an underlying recordset based on the value you select from the list. On a grouped page, the control retrieves a specific group of records.
A division of the year when the business reports and pays collected sales tax to the tax authorities.
The delivery of goods directly from the vendor to the customer.
The delivery of goods directly from the vendor to the customer.
The company placing, and often paying for, a promotional message, or advertisement.

In text-based computer graphics, a block of memory addresses that correspond to character spaces on a display screen. The memory allocated to each character space is used to hold the description of the character to be displayed in that space.
A title animation in Windows Movie Maker.
A report of the value of work in process.
A filter effect in Windows Movie Maker.
A directory or folder made available to users over the network.
An activity represented by a time interval that has a start time, an end time, and a duration.
The process of confirming that data passing into the system is correct and complies with predefined rules, definitions, or parameters.
The partition that contains the Windows operating system and its support files. The boot partition can be, but does not have to be, the same as the system partition.
A standardized service agreement between a cell phone user and a mobile operator that establishes data service details such as pricing, types of services, and bandwidth.
In the printing and display of characters on the screen, an imaginary horizontal line with which the base of each character, excluding descenders, is aligned.
The amount of time that can elapse before the Exchange server asks a mobile device running Exchange ActiveSync to connect again.

A component database architecture that provides efficient network and Internet access to many types of data sources, including relational data, mail files, flat files, and spreadsheets. OLE DB comprises a specialized set of COM interfaces that expose data from a variety of data stores, both relational and nonrelational.
A substitution that occurs when Windows or your printer uses a font similar to the one you used in your publication to display or print your publication.
A group of computers or other devices, such as printers and scanners, that communicate either wirelessly or by using a physical connection, such as an Ethernet cable or a phone line.
An audio effect setting that allows users with stereo headphones to experience stereo and multi-channel content without the need to set up an extensive multi-channel speaker system.
An audio effect setting that allows users with stereo headphones to experience stereo and multi-channel content without the need to set up an extensive multi-channel speaker system.
An event triggered by Windows system components that is recorded in the system log, such as the failure of a driver or other system component to load during startup.
An item on the user's My Status menu. This is a status the user can select to indicate that they are currently busy.
The » character.
An item on the Control Panel.
A discount that is offered to a purchaser for paying early or paying with cash.
A profile that contains the data needed for translating the values of a color gamut. This data includes information about color, hue, saturation, and brightness.
An animation effect that specifies how the display changes as a user moves from one item (such as a slide or Web page) to another.
An animation effect that specifies how the display changes as a user moves from one item (such as a slide or Web page) to another.

The name of a set of members in a dimension hierarchy such that all members of the set are at the same distance from the root of the hierarchy. For example, a time hierarchy may contain the levels Year, Month, and Day.

The name of a set of members in a dimension hierarchy such that all members of the set are at the same distance from the root of the hierarchy. For example, a time hierarchy may contain the levels Year, Month, and Day.
A feature that serves as a launching point for several optional Windows tasks and OEM-defined tasks.
A feature that serves as a launching point for several optional Windows tasks and OEM-defined tasks.
One or more identifying lines printed at the top of a page. A header may contain a page number, a date, the author's name, and the document title, the name of chapter.

The UI element that initiates the process of seeking a particular file or specific data. A search is carried out by a program through comparison or calculation to determine whether a match to some pattern exists or whether some other criteria have been met.

The UI element that initiates the process of seeking a particular file or specific data. A search is carried out by a program through comparison or calculation to determine whether a match to some pattern exists or whether some other criteria have been met.
A Windows NT domain that holds user account data.
A Windows NT domain that holds user account data.
A person who is allowed to view and read content.

A system that uses information from the manufacturing area and elsewhere to communicate status about production orders and work centers for planning and management purposes. Shop floor control encompasses a variety of functions for managing personnel, materials, and processes, and supports planning, scheduling, and costing systems.
Displacement of the left or right edge of a block of text in relation to the margin or to other blocks of text.
Displacement of the left or right edge of a block of text in relation to the margin or to other blocks of text.
A picture or other object placed within a line of text that retains its place next to adjacent text when text is added or deleted.
A user-defined shortcut to the most commonly used forms, reports, websites, etc.
Pertaining to the delivery of information that combines different content formats, such as video, audio, still images, graphics, animation, and text.
A standardized 18-digit label that uniquely identifies each unit to be transported or stored.
A standardized 18-digit label that uniquely identifies each unit to be transported or stored.
A collection of tools such as a spelling checker, grammar checker, and thesaurus.
A feature of e-mail programs that allows a user to send a copy of an e-mail message to a recipient without notifying other recipients that this was done.
A feature of e-mail programs that allows a user to send a copy of an e-mail message to a recipient without notifying other recipients that this was done.
In a tree structure, the element of which a given element is a child. Equivalent to a parent element.
In a tree structure, the element of which a given element is a child. Equivalent to a parent element.
A tool in Windows Vista that restores the entire computer (OS, settings, and files).

In DNS, each part of a DNS domain name that represents a node in the domain namespace tree. For example, the three labels example, microsoft, and com make up the DNS domain name example.microsoft.com. Each label used in a DNS name cannot exceed 63 octets, 255 bytes including the terminating dot, for the fully qualified domain name (FQDN).
An extra item that is added to the sales or purchase order lines when a certain quantity of an item is sold or purchased.
A list of options from which a user can choose. The options can be represented as text or graphics. A menu can contain other menus (submenus).
A pointed input device that comes with a mobile device or tablet PC, and is used to navigate through applications and to input information.
A pointed input device that comes with a mobile device or tablet PC, and is used to navigate through applications and to input information.
An option on Windows Parental Control that, if selected, creates logs of all the actions performed by a user on the computer.
An interface that is used to navigate the menus of a Unified Messaging (UM) system using speech inputs.
An interface that is used to navigate the menus of a Unified Messaging (UM) system using speech inputs.
A personal record of experiences, occurrances or proceedings, like a Baby Book or Life Book.
One of many sequential images that make up video or animation.
A statement that estimates projected income and expenses for a period of time.
The exchange of text messages and computer files over a communications network, such as a local area network or the Internet.
The exchange of text messages and computer files over a communications network, such as a local area network or the Internet.
The exchange of text messages and computer files over a communications network, such as a local area network or the Internet.
A credit animation in Windows Movie Maker.
An object (such as a customer, item, or employee) that shares a set of defined attributes or characteristics, and that is used to manage rules for data.
An object (such as a customer, item, or employee) that shares a set of defined attributes or characteristics, and that is used to manage rules for data.
A quick movement of a finger or pen on a screen that the computer interprets as a command, rather than as a mouse movement, writing, or drawing.
In printing, the process of eliminating white lines between colours by printing small areas of overlapping colour where colours touch.
The date after which an item is no longer usable.
The date after which an item is no longer usable.
The ) character.
Pertaining to a file format that does not allow for VBA code. Office 12 default file formats are macro-free. Examples of file extensions for macro-free formats are .docx, .pptx, .xlsx.
As one aspect of a KPI, the desired level of performance with respect to a specific business goal or strategy. Actual values are evaluated against the target to determine KPI score and status.
An interactive tool that makes it easier to set up commonly used accessibility features by specifying options by type of disability, rather than by numeric value changes.
A status message displayed when the caller ID of an incoming call is blocked.
A color that is defined by the operating system for a specific type of monitor and video adapter and that is associated with a specific part of the user interface, such as a window title or a menu.
The horizontal reference line on a grid, chart, or graph that has horizontal and vertical dimensions.
The horizontal reference line on a grid, chart, or graph that has horizontal and vertical dimensions.
To publish or write entries for a blog.

The ability to interpret vocal commands or convert spoken words into computer-readable text. Speech recognition programs enable you to control an application or enter text by speaking into a microphone, rather than by using a keyboard.

The ability to interpret vocal commands or convert spoken words into computer-readable text. Speech recognition programs enable you to control an application or enter text by speaking into a microphone, rather than by using a keyboard.
The process of tracing the quantity of a required item to its source.
The ability of hardware devices or software packages to transmit data between other devices or packages.
To update displayed information with current data.
A string value that is used to identify a named property within a given property set. Note that property names and property IDs are mutually exclusive.
A static image of a set of data, such as the records displayed as the result of a query.
A static image of a set of data, such as the records displayed as the result of a query.
A build promoted for use or deployment. A release can be internal and used for further testing or external and released or deployed.
An add-on software solution that complements the functionality of a product and that focuses on specific business processes.
To grant a person, computer process, or device access to certain information, services or functionality.
An official notice of a bank debit transaction.
A bar marked off in units of measure (such as inches) that is displayed across the top of the document window.
An image that appears as the background to a document. Generally faded and transparent, so that text can be clearly read over it.
A representation of facts, concepts or instructions in a formalized manner, suitable for communication, interpretation or processing.
A line that separates groups of controls (on a surface) or commands (on a menu).
A command button used in a toolbar (or status bar).
A business document that is a view of a customer invoice or vendor invoice that documents a payment request but is not an offer or a demand for payment.
An indicator of a company's ability to meet its long-term financial obligations, calculated by dividing net worth by total assets.
The branch of management that plans and controls the holding of inventory. Inventory management does not manage the inventory itself, but rather plans for such things as levels to maintain.
A cell range that you consolidate in the destination area you specify.
A handling unit for shipping and receiving items.
A database object that prints information formatted and organized according to your specifications.
One or more lines of text in the bottom margin area of a page. A footer may contain elements such as the page number, the name of the file, or the date.
The process of approximating a number by representing it with a fewer number of digits.
A window used to view or modify the properties of various objects such as tables, queries, fields, forms, reports, data access pages, and controls.
A list that allows you to block a language encoding or character set in order to filter out unwanted international e-mail messages that display in a language you don't understand.
A string of text written in the command language and passed to the command interpreter for execution.
Additional information for the customer that should be informative but not essential to the task.
When referring to software, to remove program files and folders from the hard disk and remove related data from the registry so the software or solution is no longer available.
A list that allows you to block top-level domain names. Blocking country/region top-level domains allows you to filter unwanted e-mail messages you receive from specific countries or regions.
To do over again.
A person who acts as a connection to another organization or group, or who provides special information.
A peer-to-peer file sharing client used to connect to file sharing networks in order to download or share files.

The process of changing the values in cells to see how those changes affect the outcome of formulas on a worksheet. For example, varying the interest rate that is used in an amortization table to determine the amount of the payments.
An option that displays the Web page in a Web browser.
A technique in which you filter records in a form, datasheet, or data access page to retrieve only those records that don't contain the selected value.

A text element consisting of a base character and a diacritic or accent mark. Although most common in the Latin script, other scripts (including Greek, Devanagari, and Tamil) also have composite characters.
A handle that is displayed on some objects such as toolbars, tables, or on individual rows or columns, that allows the user to drag them to another location.
A mechanism to provide feedback about the production process. A job card lists the individual job numbers of a specific operation, along with actual consumption statistics.

Work or information that provides support - possibly critical support-for a computing process but is not an intrinsic part of the operation or data. Overhead often adds to processing time but is generally necessary.
The area on the right side of the Windows taskbar. It contains shortcuts to programs and important status information.
The area on the right side of the Windows taskbar. It contains shortcuts to programs and important status information.
A computer desktop area that extends across all displays that are connected to a computer.
The difference between the sales and the direct costs of the products sold.
A box formed by the intersection of a row and a column in a worksheet or a table, in which you enter information.
The act of entering and editing text with a word processor.
An identifier in the form OLEServerName.ObjectName (for example, Excel.Sheet or PowerPoint.Slide) that's used by the Windows registry to uniquely identify an object.
An identifier in the form OLEServerName.ObjectName (for example, Excel.Sheet or PowerPoint.Slide) that's used by the Windows registry to uniquely identify an object.
The string that is used to define how to dial someone from outside of their country/region.
To change the size of an element on the screen.
The display of data or an image from a given perspective or location.

An account that is intended to be used to run a service. A service account has privileges beyond those provided when a service is run as part of the system, such as the ability to connect over the network to another computer.
A document describing a company's position on privacy, detailing what information it collects, with whom the data is shared, and how users can control the use of their personal information.

Pertaining to, being, or characteristic of something that is not dependent on timing. Each application or command runs in the specified order, but the specified item does not wait for any previously started processes to finish before an application or command runs.
A policy tool that gives authors control over how recipients use the documents and e-mails they send.
A policy tool that gives authors control over how recipients use the documents and e-mails they send.
Text or some other element used in an application as an indicator that the user should enter in his or her own text.

Text that is added to e-mail messages in transport to provide information that supports the sending organization's compliance policies, warnings about unknown or unverified e-mail senders, or other information as determined by the sending organization. Exchange Server 2007 allows the administrator to use transport rules to target disclaimers based on specific criteria.
A line that separates the numerator and denominator of a fraction.
An item that lets a user rename a group, when the group name in the Contacts list is right-clicked.
A small space on the To-Do Bar where the user can input tasks directly. The default label reads "Type a new task".
The < character.
The < character.
Data from a table, form, query, view, or stored procedure, displayed in a row-and-column format.

A highspeed network that can carry voice, data, and images at up to 200 Mbps or faster over distances of up to 75 km. Based on the network architecture, the transmission speed can be higher for shorter distances. A MAN, which can include one or more LANs as well as telecommunications equipment such as microwave and satellite relay stations, is smaller than a wide area network but generally operates at a higher speed.

A highspeed network that can carry voice, data, and images at up to 200 Mbps or faster over distances of up to 75 km. Based on the network architecture, the transmission speed can be higher for shorter distances. A MAN, which can include one or more LANs as well as telecommunications equipment such as microwave and satellite relay stations, is smaller than a wide area network but generally operates at a higher speed.

A view that is designed for reading documents on a computer screen. The document is resized to fit the screen and most toolbars are removed, but commands are available for navigating, commenting, and looking up words.
Information about the reading level of a document in Word.
An optional Live Meeting tool that allows users to create Live Meeting slides and add a presenter photo as part of a Microsoft PowerPoint file.
A type of chart that compares the aggregate values of a number of data series.

A design template that also contains text suggestions on each slide. You replace the text suggestions with the text that you want. A content template contains a slide master and an optional title master.
An amount added to the current or standard cost that is used to determine the sale price of various items.
To put new data in the place of other data, usually after conducting a search for the data to be replaced. Text-based applications such as word processors typically include Find and Replace commands.
Relating to frequencies within the range of perception by the human ear - from about 15 to 20,000 hertz (cycles per second).
A specific task in the manufacturing process.
A type of markup in markup languages. A start tag is the starting element of a tag pair which contains metainformation about some part of the text.
An action to be taken by a service technician as part of a service order.
A button that opens Sync Center.
The date that the selling party should ship items to meet the customer's or vendor's requested receipt date.

The basic structure of a view. When you create a view, you must first select one of five view types (table, timeline, day/week/month, card, or icon) to determine how information will be arranged and formatted in your new view.
A collective grouping of projects, usually including a common set of goals, plans and measurement of success, that is managed and delivered in a coordinated way.
A user who can schedule meetings, send invitations, do all the sharing activities in a meeting, and admit participants from the lobby.
A thread that creates multiple message copies and places them in the appropriate link queues. The dispatcher then triggers XFER OUT threads to process the fan-out message copies.
The width-to-height ratio of a video or still image, or of the screen on which an image is displayed.
The width-to-height ratio of a video or still image, or of the screen on which an image is displayed.
An item on the user's My Status menu that can be selected to indicate that the user is away from the computer but will return shortly.
A property whose value can be set to the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) of the dictionary, an error message, or an empty string if no dictionary URI is found.
A command button that is clicked to display a drop-down menu instead of performing a command.
A feature of a computer or operating system that allows it to run programs written for a different system.

The area of the workspace that contains the options you select for a given task. Workpanes appear at certain times, such as when a document is opened, or when you click certain items on menus and toolbars.
A file that contains audio, video, or script data.

The time when the most recent synchronization process was successfully completed. The last synchronization time determines when the next automatic synchronization will take place. The next automatic synchronization is performed at predefined points in time starting from the last synchronization time.

The time when the most recent synchronization process was successfully completed. The last synchronization time determines when the next automatic synchronization will take place. The next automatic synchronization is performed at predefined points in time starting from the last synchronization time.

Occurring on the client side of a client-server system. For example, on the World Wide Web, JavaScript scripts are client-side because they are executed by your browser (the client). In contrast, CGI scripts are server-side because they run on the Web server. Java applets can be either server-side or client-side depending on which computer (the server or the client) executes them.
The data that is contained within a worksheet outline. Outline data includes both the summary and detail rows or columns of an outline.
A task that is part of an operating system or program, and is operating without interaction with the user while the user is working on another task.

The practice of deploying new Edge Transport servers based on the configuration information of a previously configured source server. The configuration information of the previously configured source server is copied and exported to an XML file, which is then imported to the target server.
A graphic or other object that is inserted in the drawing layer so that you can position it precisely on the page or in front of or behind text or other objects.
A toolbar that is part of an application when it's installed on your computer.
Malware that replicates, commonly by infecting other files in the system, thus allowing the execution of the malware code and its propagation when those files are activated.
The ] character.
A wireless implementation and the second generation of WPA security that is based on the final IEEE 802.11i amendment to the 802.11 standard.
A wireless implementation and the second generation of WPA security that is based on the final IEEE 802.11i amendment to the 802.11 standard.

The union of European countries into one single market established under the Treaty of Rome in 1957. (Formerly known as the European Community or EC.) Directives have been developed to standardize member states in Europe into a common market by removing frontier fiscal barriers.
A value-added tax (VAT) report required in EU member countries. The EU sales list reports the value of goods that were sold to VAT-registered customers in other EU member countries.
Personal Area Networks (PAN) that communicate directly between one or more Bluetooth-enabled computers or devices.
Personal Area Networks (PAN) that communicate directly between one or more Bluetooth-enabled computers or devices.
An area in a browser or mail program that displays various information or messages for the user.
The process of creating usable goods from raw materials and/or parts.
A descriptive text string that identifies a page.
The difference between revenue obtained from sales and expense incurred in product delivery activities.
A quantity of one item or a number of items of the same kind.
A sound that becomes audible to the user to trigger an action by the user.
To cause an application to display information on a computer or device screen.
A view that shows the headings of a document indented to represent their level in the document's structure. You can also use this view to work with master documents.
The feature that supplies a caller with information and performs an action without the intervention of a human operator. It automatically routes calls based on selections made by the caller.
The prefix that is used to direct a call internationally. The International Access Code is 011 in the United States and 00 in much of the rest of the world.

A communications channel that permanently connects two or more locations. Dedicated lines are private or leased lines, rather than public ones. T1 lines, which are used by many organizations for Internet connectivity, are examples of dedicated lines.
A setting for the phone keyboard that causes a key to continue to produce a tone as long as the key is pressed.
The one who sends an electronic message.
One of a set of cryptographic algorithms specified by the US National Security Agency to provide an interoperable standard for government and industry.
The [ character.
An item of a custom group field. A custom group contains two or more items from a row or column field.
A holding place for a group of linked documents or Works tasks / templates related to a single user activity.
A type of contract in which the final price paid is based on the amount of time it took to complete the project and the cost of the materials used.
The HTTP Web address or public folder where client computers can download an offline address book. Public folder distribution is required for Outlook 2003 or earlier clients.
The HTTP Web address or public folder where client computers can download an offline address book. Public folder distribution is required for Outlook 2003 or earlier clients.
A request to move items to or from quarantine.
A folder that stores items deleted by the user.

An agent on the Receive connector and Send connector on a computer that has the Edge Transport server role installed, which lets e-mail administrators modify the addresses of senders and recipients on messages that enter and leave an Exchange Server 2007 organization.

The Windows Plug and Play system component that drives the process of locating devices, setting up their nodes in the hardware tree, and running the resources allocation process. Each of the three phases of configuration management--boot time, real mode, and protected mode--have their own configuration managers.

A pane that displays details about an item selected in another portion of the user interface. For example, in Microsoft Management Console (MMC), the details pane is the right pane that displays details for the selected item in the console tree.

A Post-Script file format that can be used as an independent entity. The EPS image must be incorporated into the Post-Script output of an application such as a desktop publisher. Many high-quality clip-art packages consist of such images.
A 32-bit value which consists of the language ID in the low word (bits 0-15) and the sorting ID (bits 16-19) and a reserved value (bits 20-31) in the high word.
A 32-bit value which consists of the language ID in the low word (bits 0-15) and the sorting ID (bits 16-19) and a reserved value (bits 20-31) in the high word.
An image that shows all or part of a computer screen or other display.

The order of evaluation (from highest to lowest solve order) and calculation (from lowest to highest solve order) for calculated members, custom members, custom rollup formulas, and calculated cells in a single calculation pass of a multidimensional cube.
A form contained within another form or a report.

A group of independent computers that work together to provide a common set of services and present a single-system image to clients. The use of a cluster enhances the availability of the services and the scalability and manageability of the operating system that provides the services.
To enlarge a selected portion of a graphical image or document to fill a window or the screen.
To enlarge a selected portion of a graphical image or document to fill a window or the screen.

A Regional and Language Options setting that specifies the default code pages and associated bitmap font files for a specific computer that affects all of that computer's users. The default code pages and fonts enable a non-Unicode application written for one operating system language version to run correctly on another operating system language version.
The lead time required to produce an item, starting from the time the order is released to production until the item is moved to inventory.
A central table in a data warehouse schema that contains numerical measures and keys relating facts to dimension tables.
A single attribute candidate key whose values are system-generated and that does not represent properties that identify objects in the real world.
The list of animation sequences for a slide. Items are listed in the order in which they are added, and include icons that indicate timing in relation to other animation events.
A monitoring option in real-time spyware protection that monitors various types and areas of software activity on your computer.
A time buffer, specified in days, that is added to order due dates to protect against unplanned delays in the item lead time.

A row, column, or block of buttons or icons, usually displayed across the top of the screen, that represent tasks or commands within the program. The toolbar buttons provide shortcuts to common tasks frequently accessed from the menus.
A standard Windows control that is similar to a standard text box, except that it also supports individual character and paragraph properties.
The part of a transfer order that specifies detailed information about a request to transfer a specific item to a different warehouse.
A formula that performs multiple calculations on one or more sets of values, and then returns either a single result or multiple results.

A chart that is placed on a worksheet rather than on a separate chart sheet. Embedded charts are beneficial when you want to view or print a chart or a PivotChart report with its source data or other information in a worksheet.
A graphic or diagram that displays data or the relationships between sets of data in pictorial rather than numeric form.

Pertaining to a user who, during business hours (or at any time if no business hours have been set), is not signed in to any Lync or Communicator, or IM device and cannot be contacted by phone (no call forwarding information is published).
A list that can be opened to reveal all choices for a given field.
To make resources, such as folders, printers, records, etc., unavailable to others.
The date that an asset is ready and available for service.
A category of objects that share a common set of characteristics.
A category of objects that share a common set of characteristics.
A quantity assigned to an element such as a variable, symbol, or label.
To store data in such a way that it can be retrieved later by the same security support component, and only by that security support component.

A table, query, form, report, macro, or module that remains in the replica or Design Master where it was created. Neither the object nor changes to the object are copied to other members in the replica set.

A style of processing where an application posts a request for an event to occur and then continues without waiting for the event. A separate service will recognize the request and take responsibility for ensuring that the event occurs.
An option that applies a read-only state to a document inside client applications.
To associate a flag with a message or other item.
A software program that reduces a file's size for storage on a disk. If a compressed file is too large to fit onto a single disk, the compression utility copies it onto multiple disks.
Erroneous or unrecognizable because of a flaw in reasoning or an error in input. Invalid results, for example, might occur if the logic in a program is faulty.
A computational proof that Outlook applies to outgoing messages to help recipient messaging systems distinguish legitimate e-mail from junk e-mail.
A fee that is charged to a customer for the collection of a bill of exchange remittance.
A method of capturing sales orders and purchase orders using a software application.

A method of depreciation that uses a progressive or digressive factor. For example, if the factor is >50, the depreciation is progressive, which means that the amount of depreciation increases each depreciation period. If the factor is <50, the depreciation is digressive, and the amount of depreciation decreases each depreciation period.
A menu item in Internet Explorer that turns on the tool for Tablet PC users that allows the user to move the content of the page up and down, like a mouse scroll wheel.
To reverse changes.
A group of posting accounts that show the amounts owed to suppliers or creditors for goods, supplies, or services purchased on credit.
A group of posting accounts that show the amounts owed to suppliers or creditors for goods, supplies, or services purchased on credit.
The © character. Normally included at the beginning of a copyright notice.
A directory that receives RFC-822 compliant files from the file system for the purpose of creating message objects that can be passed to the Submission queue.
The pane in normal view in which you type notes that you want to accompany a slide. You print these notes as notes pages or have them display when you save a presentation as a Web page.
The activities and actions performed by customer service representatives to assist customers.

In the Internet and other networks, the highest subdivision of a domain name in a network address, which identifies the type of entity owning the address (for example, .com for commercial users or .edu for educational institutions) or the geographical location of the address (for example, .fr for France or .sg for Singapore). The domain is the last part of the address (for example, www.acm.org).

In the Internet and other networks, the highest subdivision of a domain name in a network address, which identifies the type of entity owning the address (for example, .com for commercial users or .edu for educational institutions) or the geographical location of the address (for example, .fr for France or .sg for Singapore). The domain is the last part of the address (for example, www.acm.org).
A unit of work that is represented to users in the form of buttons, links, and menu items.
To move an item to a higher level within a tree structure.
A normal sales order that is created in an intercompany company for an external customer and that automatically generates intercompany orders.
The / character.

A set of syntax rules for mark-up tags and their interpretation. Within an HTML (or XML) document, a DTD provides specific information on what tags are used in the document (and in what order those tags should appear), which tags can appear inside other ones, which tags have attributes, and so forth. Originally developed for use with Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML), DTD defines the relationships between document elements.

A set of syntax rules for mark-up tags and their interpretation. Within an HTML (or XML) document, a DTD provides specific information on what tags are used in the document (and in what order those tags should appear), which tags can appear inside other ones, which tags have attributes, and so forth. Originally developed for use with Standard Generalized Markup Language (SGML), DTD defines the relationships between document elements.
The 802.11b standard for wireless networking. A standard for delivering digital information over high-frequency, wireless local area networks.
The 802.11b standard for wireless networking. A standard for delivering digital information over high-frequency, wireless local area networks.
A non-physical fixed asset that a company uses to conduct its business.

The server name, user name, password, and e-mail address used to connect to an e-mail service. You create the e-mail account using information provided by your mail administrator or Internet service provider (ISP).
To create a user session for an Internet account. For example, you sign in to a Microsoft account, an Internet service provider account, or Skype.
A single media file, including art, sound, animation, or movies.
A single media file, including art, sound, animation, or movies.
A screen showing an active conference call.
To enroll in a service, often resulting in setting up a new account.
A case distinction in which every word's first chararacter is uppercase and the remaining letters are lower case.
A field code that marks specific text for inclusion in an index. When you mark text as an index entry, Microsoft Office Word inserts an XE (Index Entry) field formatted as hidden text.
The ” character.
The ” character.
A control panel that provides the status of your network and access to networking activities.
A range of cells that shows how changing certain values in your formulas affects the results of the formulas.
A group of things, such as invoices, sales orders, or productions, that have characteristics in common and are to be handled in a similar fashion.

A feature of Microsoft Office Live Web sites and Shared Sites that allows users to restore their Web site or Shared Sites from backups maintained on Microsoft servers. This feature also allows users to switch to Microsoft FrontPage for creating their Web pages and to select a time zone for their Shared Sites.
To insert content, such as text or a graphic, that has been cut or copied from one document into a different location in the same or a different document.
The string that is received with a new call that is used to associate the call with a dial plan.
A program that creates files or makes changes to existing files.
A program that creates files or makes changes to existing files.
A system that sends and receives messages in the form of sound recordings.
To identify or designate with a label; describe or classify.
To make a duplicate copy of a program, a disk, or data.
A cell in a layout table.

Pertaining to keyboard settings, document views, user interface objects, and languages for which text is displayed in a left-to-right direction. English and most other European languages are left-to-right languages.
A control in Windows that enables the user to choose one option from a list of possibilities.
The part of a hyperlink in a document or Web page that displays as text on the screen.
A movable piece on a device that is pressed to activate some function.
A movable piece on a device that is pressed to activate some function.

Placement of an element relative to either the element's parent or, if there isn't one, the body. Values for the element's Left and Top properties are relative to the upper-left corner of the element's parent.
Indirect compensation or reward offered by an organization.
A view of a document as it will appear when you print it.
A table outside the open database or project.
The digital signature functionality including Digital Signatures, electronic signatures, Mark As Final and Electronic Postmarks.
A color that is not part of a color scheme.
A color that is not part of a color scheme.
A project without a direct customer relation.
A set of graphics, text, and colors for defining different levels of performance when comparing an actual value and a target value within a KPI.

A time-stamped record of all the changes that users make to a record. An audit trail also contains the name and identification of the user who made the change, and typically includes the reason for the change.
A UI command used to switch between accounts on a device.
An Active Directory object that contains information about an individual such as name, address, and job title. It can include a foreign e-mail address.
The overall plan or design of a document system.
The part of a production order that specifies detailed information about the components included in the order.
The part of a production order that specifies detailed information about the components included in the order.
In computer design, the arrangement of circuits and other components of the system.
A ledger account into which transactions are entered as they await manual approval by the person who is specified in the journal line.
Pertaining to characters that are formatted to appear darker and heavier than the surrounding text.

A storage system with multiple tiers that can accommodate pallets or other standardized containers. Typically, a rack holds pallets in vertical sections, but some can also be more than one pallet deep.

The electronic components that generate the video signal sent through a cable to a video display. The video adapter is usually located on the computer's main system board or on an expansion board, but it is sometimes built into the terminal.

The electronic components that generate the video signal sent through a cable to a video display. The video adapter is usually located on the computer's main system board or on an expansion board, but it is sometimes built into the terminal.
A unit of information transmitted as a whole from one device to another on a network.

Code that is executed by the common language runtime environment rather than directly by the operating system. Managed code applications gain common language runtime services such as automatic garbage collection, runtime type checking and security support, and so on.
