A series of 18 digits used to identify bank accounts and their holders in Mexico and used to route electronic funds transfers.
A series of 11 alphanumeric characters used by the Indian Financial System to identify banks participating in the NEFT system and to route transactions between banks.
An online escrow payment service in China that allows customers to complete financial transactions after verifying goods purchased are delivered as promised.
A commercial bank in Brazil.
A series of 9 digits used to identify Russian Federation banks for routing transactions.
Information that identifies banks and bank account holders in France that includes bank codes, branch codes, account number, and name of the account holder.
A series of 6 digits used in Australia and New Zealand to identify banks and their branches and for routing transactions.
A 20-digit number used to identify a Central Bank of Russian Federation account needed to facilitate international transactions.
A 10-12 digit number used to identify individual and organizational taxpayers in the Russian Federation receiving funds through an international transaction.
A numerical code used in combination with a beneficiary INN to identify and categorize a taxpayer identity in the Russian Federation.
An 8 or 9-digit number issued to all individuals and organizations in Chile for identification and taxation purposes during an international financial transaction.
A banking and financial services company in Brazil.
A numeric code used in combination with a bank code to identify a specific bank branch.
A numeric code that identifies taxpayers who perform self-employed work in Brazil.
A 9-digit code used to identify banks for routing transactions in the Russian Federation.
A statistical code defined by the Central Bank of Russia used to describe the subjects of payments denominated in Russian roubles for cross-border transactions.
A 14-digit identification number issued to Brazilian companies by the Brazilian Ministry of Revenue for tax purposes.
A 14-digit identification number issued to Brazilian companies by the Brazilian Ministry of Revenue for tax purposes.
An account established by a banking institution to make transactions on behalf of another financial institution, usually for international transactions.
An 11-digit identification number issued to Brazilians and resident aliens by the Brazilian Ministry of Revenue for identification and tax purposes.
An 11-digit identification number issued to Brazilians and resident aliens by the Brazilian Ministry of Revenue for identification and tax purposes.
An eCommerce services company that provides electronic payment and fraud prevention services.
A company that provides accounts receivable and debt collection services.
A company that provides payment gateway services for Korean markets.
A fee imposed by some financial and banking institutions on international financial transactions.

A commercial document or contract, or the number identifying a commercial document or contract, that is issued by a buyer to a seller that identifies agreed upon prices, goods, payments, and services.
A banking and financial services company in Brazil.
An international credit card company based in Japan or a term used to describe the brand of cards issued by JCB.
An eCommerce payment and escrow service available in a number of Latin American countries/regions.
The actual physical or virtual object that facilitates a purchase or transaction, such as a physical credit card, financial services account, or payment escrow service account.
A fraud prevention mechanism that attempts to verify that an individual using a payment instrument is authorized to use or is the owner of that instrument.
An eCommerce payment escrow and financial services company or the service that the company provides.
The identifying information for a payment instrument.
A unique code used to identify a purchase for transaction tracking and billing purposes.
A Standard Entry Class ACH code that describes a type of financial transaction.
A series of numbers used to identify banks and transaction routing information for South African financial institutes.
An international identification code used to identify financial institutions for international money transfers.
An online payment method using UnionPay bank cards or services from China.
An identifying number required to perform payment transactions from Belarus individuals or companies.
The agreement between Microsoft and its customers for the use of certain online consumer services provided by Microsoft.
A capacity used to store files and data on a local drive or cloud service.
The maximum storage space users are allowed to use in a cloud service, as determined by a storage plan.
A service that tracks regions of storage and may move data between them based on an input/output policy or other administrator-specified rules.
A service that tracks regions of storage and may move data between them based on an input/output policy or other administrator-specified rules.
A single-threaded apartment the thread of which is the core UI thread for an application window.
A single-threaded apartment the thread of which is the core UI thread for an application window.
To redistribute data or resources more evenly in order to change the processing capacity.
A process of importing prepared data using a software procedure rather than the end user entering the information.

An IRS tax rule in the United States that requires notified payers to withhold a set percentage from payments made to payees who cannot be identified due to missing or incorrect taxpayer identification numbers on tax forms.
An United States tax law designation given to any corporation that is a unique entity apart from and taxed separately from its owners.
A business that is owned by an individual but is not treated as a separate entity from the business owner for tax purposes.
An individual or entity that has no tax liability under US tax laws because they are not a citizen, resident alien, or an organization created or organized under the laws of the United States.
The federal revenue agency under the United States Department of the Treasury that is responsible for the collection of taxes in addition to the interpretation and enforcement of federal tax laws.
The federal revenue agency under the United States Department of the Treasury that is responsible for the collection of taxes in addition to the interpretation and enforcement of federal tax laws.

A business entity allowed for by state statutes in the United States that protects each owner (member) from personal liabilities but is not taxed since it passes all profits and losses to each member who is taxed accordingly.
An United States tax law designation given to any corporation that elects to pass corporate income, losses, deductions, and credit through to shareholders for federal tax purposes.
An official form issued by the US Internal Revenue Service that is used to provide a payee's taxation identification number to a payer.
A business that keeps money for individual people or companies, exchanges currencies, makes loans, and offers other financial services.
An identifier used by app developers and advertising networks to provide more relevant advertising to users by understanding which apps they use and how they use them.
A name of a person as it is shown in a user interface.
The category of items that have recently become available.
The app that allows users to connect remotely to a computer and access programs, files, and network resources as though they were sitting at the computer.
An arrow associated with a drop-down combo or list box or some toolbar buttons, indicating a list the user can view by clicking the arrow.
An 11-digit number issued by the Australian Taxation Office Australian Business Register to any entities registered to carry on an enterprise in Australia.
A 10-character alphanumeric identifier issued by the Indian Income Tax Department to all taxable entities for taxation and identification purposes.
A 10-character alphanumeric identifier issued by the Indian Income Tax Department to all taxable entities for taxation and identification purposes.
The official currency of the United States.
The official currency of Australia.
The official currency of the Republic of Chile.
The official currency of Switzerland.
An official currency of the People's Republic of China.
An official currency of the People's Republic of China.
A funds transfer system where irrevocable transfers of money or securities take place directly from one bank to another without waiting periods.
The official currency of Colombia.
The official currency of Denmark.
The official currency of the United Kingdom.
The official currency of Indonesia.
The official currency of India.
The official currency of Norway.
The official currency of New Zealand.
The official currency of the Russian Federation.
The official currency of Sweden.
The official currency of Turkey.
The official currency of Taiwan.
The official currency of South Africa.
A provincial sales tax collected in the province of Québec in Canada.
The total credits applied to a Microsoft Azure customer's account since a customer's last bill.

termGrp.term: leiðréttingar eftir útgáfu reiknings og leiðréttingar á viðskiptakröfum

descripGrp.descrip: The official currency of Brazil.
The official currency of Mexico.
A Microsoft subsidiary located in Geneva Switzerland.
The official currency of Canada.
The official currency of Japan.
The official currency of Korea.
The official currency of the Russian Federation.
A discounted rate for software or services available to customers who already own client access licenses (CALs).
An accounts receivable that will likely remain uncollectable and will be written off.
A moveable strip in the user interface that divides the screen between two apps.
The process of scheduling, picking, packing, and consolidating one or more shipments of warehouse inventory items for transportation and delivery.
A business process that estimates future demand and creates demand forecasts based on historical transaction data.
An estimate of future demand that is created by applying a forecasting algorithm to historical transaction data.
A method that is used to increase or decrease forecast requirements in master planning, based on user defined percentages that are applied during specific periods.
An app for the Windows Store designed for small groups of SharePoint users to enable them to perform basic tasks, such as provide access to team document libraries, site feeds, and project tasks.
A file that is only available when a device is connected to the Internet so that the file’s data uses little space in the device’s storage.
A piece of equipment that is running an operating system.
The enterprise-oriented feature which enables organizations to provide their users with access to data and documents stored on their corporate computers from anywhere.

A viewer that displays generated reports and lets users add comments to a report, create charts or graphs from report data, view various levels of a financial report, and export the report to other file types.

A viewer that displays generated reports and lets users add comments to a report, create charts or graphs from report data, view various levels of a financial report, and export the report to other file types.
A web-based viewer that displays generated reports in a web browser.
An application that uses Microsoft Dynamics ERP data to create reports in Management Reporter.
Information about a company that is used to create a report.
The code in a row definition that identifies the type of data in each line of the row definition.
To hold a row of a report in a static position so that the row continues to be displayed as you scroll up or down in the report.
To hold a column of a report in a static position so that the column continues to be displayed as you scroll right or left in the report.
A building block that uses a row definition, a column definition, and an optional reporting tree definition to build a report.
The row of a report that is used for percentage calculations in a column definition.
A building block that contains individual reporting units and is arranged like an organizational chart.
A code that defines how data is sorted in a report.
A cell in a report definition in which the content overrides the fiscal years, periods, and other information that is specified in the column definition for that row.
A named group of dimension values.
A code in a column definition that restricts or suppresses the data in a column, such as row formatting, details, and amounts.
A header in a report that is automatically updated each time the report is generated, according to the base period that is defined in the column definition.
A text-based variable in a column definition that is automatically updated each time that a report is generated.

A code in a column definition that displays or does not display a specified column, depending on certain variables or values in the column definition. If the values or variables in the specified report column do not meet the conditions of the code, the column is not displayed or printed in the report.

termGrp.term: Kóðar fyrir skilyrtar stillingar fyrir prentun

descripGrp.descrip: A value in a column definition that identifies the type of information that is displayed in that column, such as descriptive text, a calculation, financial dimensions, or an accounting attribute.
A code in a report definition that determines whether posted, unposted, or both posted and unposted financial data transactions are included in the report.
A transaction that has been entered into the financial data, but that has not yet been posted.
The reporting period that is specified in the report definition, displayed as years. The column definition can refer to the base year to specify report columns for relative time periods.
The URL or network location where a generated report is stored.
In a column definition, the list of dimensions that limit the data that is displayed for a report.
A row that is included in the data of a report but that is not printed or displayed when the report is generated, such as for complex calculations, or the graphic design of a report.

termGrp.term: lína sem ekki er til prentunar

descripGrp.descrip: A text statement that can be used for calculations, and that specifies certain conditions for the data and the resulting behavior for when those conditions are met. The statement uses the terms If, Then, and Else to identify the conditions and results.

A feature that uses the highest and lowest values from a row definition or reporting tree definition to search for accounts or dimensions that are missing from the row definition or reporting tree definition, but that exist in the financial data.
A worksheet link that combines references to cells in an external worksheet file into the same link column that is used in a report to link to accounts or dimensions.
In a row definition of a report, the column that contains the links to dimensions and external worksheet files that will be used in a report.

A worksheet link that accesses multiple rows and columns of data in an external worksheet file into a report, or that associates one or more external worksheet files with one or more reporting units in the reporting tree of a report.
A feature in the Desktop Viewer that displays the comments in a report and any charts that were created from report data.
A feature that allows a user to access the Microsoft Dynamics ERP system from the account level of a report to obtain more information.
The maximum limit of a cumulative transaction value, up to which a tax on the transaction value is not calculated.

The maximum limit of an individual transaction value that is a part of a cumulative transaction value, up to which a tax on the transaction value is not calculated. The exceptional threshold is applied to an individual transaction value that is a part of a cumulative transaction value that is within the cumulative threshold.
The maximum limit of a transaction value, up to which a tax on the transaction value is not calculated.
The maximum limit of a cumulative transaction value, up to which a tax on the transaction value is calculated by using concessional rates instead of standard rates.
The process of reserving dates and times for the pickup and delivery of truckloads of goods at specific warehouse locations.
A permanent location that is assigned to an item in a warehouse. Multiple items can have the same fixed location, and a single item can have multiple fixed locations.
A person or company contracted by a customer to consolidate loads into shipments and then transport and deliver those loads to specified destinations.
A freight delivery route that entails two or more stops, where the carrier delivers loads either from a single supplier to multiple buyers or from multiple suppliers to a single buyer.
The selection of carrier routes for transporting freight from origin points to destination points.
A tool that you can use to categorize inventory items for quick searching. Filters also restrict the availability of items to customers, vendors, and warehouse processes.
A group of warehouse-related work items of the same type, based on user-defined criteria (such as location and inventory number).
A warehouse process where you can control inventory items for multiple orders, shipments, loads, or waves at the docks when inbound items are received or outbound items are loaded.

A piece of handheld equipment such as a portable music or video player, PDA (personal digital assistant), mobile phone, or warehouse device that works on its own but can also be connected to a computer. Many of these devices can sync information with Windows. Warehouse mobile devices use barcode technology to process inventory operations.
The estimated taxes from production and supply chain that apply to an item or service.
An inventory counting method where items that are stored in different warehouse locations are counted to verify the on-hand inventory levels and to facilitate inventory-level corrections.

A unique number that is assigned to a warehouse entity such as a pallet, bin, cart, or individual item for tracking inventory. You can use this number to ascertain the item location, item quantity, product dimension, and tracking dimension of the entity.
An inventory management process in which a warehouse location is automatically or manually restocked based on predefined criteria to maintain the correct inventory levels at the location.

A quantity of freight that is created against a source document such as a sales order, purchase order, or transfer order, and that is transported from an origin point to a destination point. You can consolidate inbound or outbound shipments that are going to the same destination point into a single load.

A logical grouping of warehouse work items that is created by means of a wave template configuration, processed either automatically or manually, and then released to pick the items for production or shipping.

The entire range of inventory-related tasks that are performed by a company's warehouse employees. The creation of warehouse work is triggered either automatically by user-defined settings or manually by a worker. Each work item is performed on a mobile device by a warehouse worker.
A sales order, purchase order, or transfer order that is ready for transportation planning.
A messaging app that allows Yammer users to quickly chat with their coworkers wherever they are.

The calculated value-added tax (VAT) amount that is not due until the invoice is paid. This amount is posted to an unrealized purchase VAT account and can be claimed only after the receipt of a receipt/tax invoice or a tax invoice.

The calculated value-added tax (VAT) amount that is not due until the invoice is paid. This amount is posted to an unrealized purchase VAT account and can be claimed only after the receipt of a receipt/tax invoice or a tax invoice.

The calculated value-added tax (VAT) amount that is not due until the invoice is paid. This amount is posted to an unrealized sales VAT account and can be claimed only after a receipt or tax invoice is printed.

The calculated value-added tax (VAT) amount that is not due until the invoice is paid. This amount is posted to an unrealized sales VAT account and can be claimed only after a receipt or tax invoice is printed.
The tax on an organization’s purchases or input supplies, which is levied on the purchase price.
The tax on an organization’s purchases or input supplies, which is levied on the purchase price.
The tax on an organization’s sales, which is levied on the sales price.
The tax on an organization’s sales, which is levied on the sales price.

A branch office that is used to record value-added tax (VAT) and inventory movement. All the branch offices of a VAT-registered legal entity are referred to as tax branches. Each tax branch uses the same tax registration number as the head office of the legal entity.
To show or share screen content in a display other than the primary display.
The website hosted by Microsoft where users can browse community-approved wiki articles, post questions and answers or start a discussion on technology-related topics.
The act of revealing the identity.
A presence status the users can select, while in a Lync conference call, to make it appear to other users that they do not want to be disturbed.
An option that enables the user to specify another phone number to ring at the same time his/her default phone number rings.
A presence status that is not known.
A search feature that provides immediate results to users.

A collection of rules to automatically delete documents in a site collection within a specified time period. Deletion policies can be assigned to a site collection or a site collection template. Site administrators can then select specific deletion policies and rules, and apply to document libraries in their site.

An app that enables you to capture the content of a whiteboard or document as a picture and optionally save it in OneNote. You can also access this functionality from OneNote directly in OneNote for the Windows Store, Windows Phone, iOS, and Android.
A control that allows users to plot their chart such that the x-axis data appears on the y-axis and vice versa.
An app that is included in the product when a user first starts using it.
A physical store where Microsoft sells recommended software and devices.

A process that allows for the release of contents–for example emails and their attachments, address books, and contact lists–to the next of kin of a deceased or incapacitated email account holder and/or for the closure of an email account.
A UI element that users can click to display information about a selected object.
To create an index.
To locate data based on an index.
An engine that determines and processes the apportionment of freight charges, either by weight or by volume.
An engine that calculates apportionment based on check digits.
A dimension that is used to characterize the level of detail for which a forecast is defined.
An engine that determines the apportionment of freight charges by weight.
An engine that determines the mileage that freight will travel between its origin and destination points, and calculates the shipping rate for the freight accordingly.
An engine that creates a rating structure and sets up an interface between rating services and carrier companies.
The process of locating and displaying all shipping rates that are available for a particular load.
A hierarchy that organizes multiple levels of sales tax reporting codes, such as tax types, tax components, excise record types, and service accounting codes.
A node in a sales tax hierarchy that represents sales tax information, such as the tax component or the excise record type.
A structure that contains multiple levels of sales tax reporting nodes and that does not contain data. This structure is used as a template to create a sales tax hierarchy.
An engine that calculates the number of days that it will take for shipped freight to get from its origin point to its destination point.
An engine that is called automatically when the volume of a package is not proportional to its weight.
An item and its assigned inventory dimensions.
An item and its assigned inventory dimensions.
A feature that allows a system administrator to manage the user’s experience by limiting application entry points exposed to the user of the device.
A feature that allows the replacement of the Windows shell (explorer.exe) with a custom shell for specialized device scenarios.
A feature that enables users to search for user interface controls.
Logical rules composed of predicates and actions that enable administrators to perform actions, such as allow, block, or redirect client access traffic on the Exchange Server.
The edition of Windows 8.1 that has the search engine in Internet Explorer defaulted to Bing.
The software update to Windows 8.1 that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.
The software update to Windows RT 8.1 that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.
The software update to Windows 8.1 Pro that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.
The edition of Windows 8.1 Pro that is optimized for students and educational institutions.

A feature that converts a standard form into a sensitive information type, which can then be used to define transport rules and Data Loss Protection (DLP) policies. For example, an admin might create a document fingerprint based on a blank 1040 EZ tax form, and then create a DLP policy that detects all 1040 EZ forms with sensitive content filled in.
The software update to Windows 8.1 Enterprise that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.

The software update to Windows 8.1 Single Language that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.

The software update to Windows 8.1 Pro with Media Center that gives users a more familiar and convenient experience across touch, keyboard and mouse inputs and enables more affordable Windows device choices.

termGrp.term: Windows 8.1 Pro with Media Center Update
Windows 8.1 Pro með Media Center Update

descripGrp.descrip: An application that allows the user to track financial market conditions, including personal portfolio tracking, finance articles, tools and calculator for common financial tasks.
An application that allows the user to track financial market conditions, including personal portfolio tracking, finance articles, tools and calculator for common financial tasks.
An application that provides recipes and tools for meal-planning, instructional views, and an extensive wine guide.
An application that provides recipes and tools for meal-planning, instructional views, and an extensive wine guide.
An application that includes exercise and workout videos; nutritional and medical references; and a tracker for diet, exercise, and health.
An application that includes exercise and workout videos; nutritional and medical references; and a tracker for diet, exercise, and health.
An application that aggregates news in customized views from a variety of Internet partner news sources, featuring news articles, videos, articles, and photography.
An application that aggregates news in customized views from a variety of Internet partner news sources, featuring news articles, videos, articles, and photography.
An application that allow the user to follow sports headlines, teams, scores, schedules and standings.
An application that allow the user to follow sports headlines, teams, scores, schedules and standings.
An application for travel planning, including destination photos and panoramas, travel guides, booking tools, currency conversions, and weather forecasts.
An application for travel planning, including destination photos and panoramas, travel guides, booking tools, currency conversions, and weather forecasts.
An application that provides current weather forecasts with customized locations and interactive weather maps.
An application that provides current weather forecasts with customized locations and interactive weather maps.

The edition of Windows 8.1 designed for enthusiasts and business/technical pros that includes all of the features in Windows 8.1, plus features for encryption, virtualization, PC management, and domain connectivity.
The edition of Windows 8.1 that is available only through volume licensing.
The edition of Windows 8.1 designed to make Windows affordable to mainstream consumers in emerging markets.
The edition of Windows 8.1 Pro that contains Windows Media Center.
A UI option that enables the user to add content from an application to OneNote.
The service provided by Microsoft where users can manage their event registrations, bookmark events and webcasts, and gain access to other content.
A feature that enables you to protect a file by using a password. You can specify a password and lock down the file so that other users cannot open or modify it.
A resource property that requires project managers to seek approval from resource managers before assigning a resource to a particular project.
The negotiation between the project managers and their team leaders to commit resources to certain work.
A set of features in the Office 365 Compliance center that provides customers with the ability to understand and control the use of their spreadsheets.
The strongest signal from a specific user's graph that is shown in the activity area.
A feature that allows the user to track cardio activities, including distance, time, pace and calories.

A web page where you specify email addresses that can create pages in your OneNote notebooks. When messages from an enabled email address are sent to me@onenote.com, OneNote creates a new page in your OneNote notebook on OneDrive.

A feature that enables users to send content via email to their OneNote notebooks. Users must first enable their email addresses in the Email Settings page in OneNote. Then, they can email content to me@onenote.com, which automatically copies the content to a new page in their notebook.
A browser-based tool that enables users to save web pages to OneNote.

An app that runs in a non-desktop app model, regardless of target OS (currently Windows, Windows Phone, and/or Xbox) and UI framework (e.g., XAML, WinJS, DX, Silverlight) and whether or not it is sold or deployed via the Store.
A set of web-based API instructions and requirements for creating, retrieving, and modifying pages in OneNote.
A list of OneNote notebooks stored on OneDrive that you either own or is shared with you, and that is available at OneNote.com/notebooks.
A partially completed diagram that includes shapes and tips to help the user get started in Visio. A user can select from three diagrams at startup.
A feature that renders a PDF document as a single or series of pictures in a page.
A feature that enables IT administrators to move Personal Folders files (.pst) to a mailbox in Office 365. A .pst file is a data file that stores your messages and other items on your computer.
A HIP challenge that requires a user to view an image and then type a set of characters contained in that image.
A security task that a user must complete to verify they are a human and not a machine.
To make unavailable for use.

A licensing mode that enables Office 365 subscribers to activate Office on-premises in a shared computer environment (Remote Desktop Services) or a roaming scenario where the underlying hardware changes frequently (such as Windows To Go).

An email sent at a specified time to a user to remind them of an upcoming event. Users can create reminder emails for themselves for any event in their calendars and for all attendees (when users are also the organizers). The email contains all details of the event and optional notes that users might add.
A set of features providing accessibility options and settings to help users interact more easily with the phone.
The app that enables users to set alarms.
A card storing currency that customers can use to buy apps and similar items from Microsoft digital Stores.
A feature that provides turn-by-turn audio directions read out loud to users to go to a given destination.
The sound the phone makes when the user receives a text message.
A feature where users can add contacts that they call frequently so that they can get to their numbers quickly rather than going through the Contact list in People.
A list of contacts users can call (i.e. only shows contacts that have phone numbers associated with them).
A feature on the phone to enroll in and manage a workplace account.
An account provided by a company that allows users to install apps or hubs provided by that company, and that governs the company policies applied to the phone.
Local public transportation; the vehicles used for such transport.
A feature that allows the user to connect the phone to an external display (a PC monitor, for instance) and then display the phone screen on the external display.
A way of providing driving or walking directions to the user where the app provides both spoken and visual instructions at the right time for the user to act on those instructions.
A way of providing driving or walking directions to the user where the app provides both spoken and visual instructions at the right time for the user to act on those instructions.

A camera option that enables users to capture moving subjects by snapping multiple photos on shutter press and allowing the user to pick the best one or just accept the photo recommended by the software.
The phone's LED light used during video capture to help exposure in dark conditions.
A feature that allows you to sync some of the settings on your phone across all of your Windows 8 devices.
To touch an NFC-capable device to a tag, an NFC reader, or another device to wirelessly transfer content or information.
A ticket for transit, such as on an airplane or a train.
The hardware slot (or tray) in which a SIM card is placed. Some phones have more than one SIM slot.
The multiple photos taken on shutter press to capture moving subjects. The user can pick the best one or just accept the photo recommended by the software.
A span of IP addresses.
One of the pivots for a contact pinned to your Start screen, where you can find all your apps through which you can connect with that contact.
A feature in Settings where the user can change the settings for the cellular connection and for the SIM card.
A feature that provides quick access to settings and notifications specified by the user.
A lock screen featuring dynamically updated content.
A feature that automatically attaches users to Wi-Fi hotspots.
A surface that appears on the phone screen with a “soft” key for the Back, Start and Search button.
Currently selected media that is playing.
Automatic grouping of user’s photos and videos based on time and place.
A payment instrument for the debiting of a payer's payment account whereby a payment transaction is initiated by the payee on the basis of authorization given by the payer.
A device, connected to a USB charging cable, for charging the phone battery.
A data limit plan where users pay for data usage per byte sent/received.
A built-in camera from Microsoft set as default.

The ability to emulate the functionality of traditional smart cards, but instead of requiring the purchase of additional hardware, it uses technology that users already own and are more likely to have with them at all times.
An option in the viewfinder for available lens apps.
A button on the call progress screen for Voice over LTE (VoLTE). This button is used when a user is in a conference call and needs to drop one of the participants without ending the conference call.
To disable on-screen and sound notification.
To enable on-screen and sound notification.
The title of Settings screen in which the user can control settings for the Start screen in addition to theme color and background color settings.
A single handed device used in a number of industries, including retail, hospitality, healthcare, manufacturing, and automotive.

A subset of settings and features that can be assigned to one of four slots in action center for quick, one-tap access. In addition, they can provide useful, actionable, or critical info regarding the setting or feature.

​An app that is built using the Windows universal app platform. Developers can create a Windows universal app that runs on all Windows-based device types, or they can choose to limit an app to specific devices.
To provide Wi-Fi credentials to Outlook.com contacts, Skype contacts, and Facebook friends.
The phone's volume mode when in a call.

The use of data connection in a roaming area. Generally making phone calls or using your data connection when the phone is roaming is more expensive, and the user will be charged additional fees for voice roaming calls.
The connection on your phone that allows you to make phone calls.

A phone call made in a roaming area. Generally making phone calls or using your data connection when the phone is roaming is more expensive, and the user will be charged additional fees for voice roaming calls.
A setting to minimize distractions while driving.
A setting that determines if the screen will rotate automatically when the phone is rotated.
A Microsoft operating system designed for handheld portable devices.

A predetermined text reply that can be automatically sent in response to incoming calls, text messages, or both when Driving Mode is turned on. The text reply is sent with no action on the part of the user.
A response to an incoming call using a text message when the caller is a contact calling from a mobile phone.
A camera option to capture just one image when the user presses the camera button.
A photo you can choose to use as the background for some Live Tiles on the Start screen.

A feature that unifies components across applications, such as people, conversations, calendars, emails, and files, to create a seamless collaboration experience. Creating a Group anywhere in Office 365 will automatically provision a corresponding Yammer conversation feed, an Outlook inbox and calendar, and a SharePoint document library for every Group member. Groups make these components persistent across applications, so that changes made to components in part of Office 365 will carry through to the others, thus enabling a unified experience.
The database that stores search feature settings which include but are not limited to query rules and the search schema.
A feature that enables the user to record on-screen activity, and embeds the video automatically in PowerPoint.
The Skype software application that uses the non-desktop user interface introduced with Windows 8.
A menu that contains the most commonly used contextual commands such as Cut, Copy, Paste, Comment, and Proofing.

A user account and associated credentials that is used to access Microsoft’s and 3rd parties’ business services, such as Office 365. Work or school accounts are usually assigned to end users by their organization (work, school, non-profit) and managed by the admin. However, some business services like Yammer support work or school accounts that were created by end users, without IT involvement. We sometimes refer to these accounts as “viral” AAD accounts but we don’t use this term externally. Work or school accounts are stored in Azure Active Directory (AAD) and managed by Microsoft on behalf of the organization. One of the key difference with a Microsoft account is that users don’t own the account and will typically loose access to it if they leave the organization. Other aspects like password policies are imposed by admins.

A user account and associated credentials that is used to access Microsoft’s and 3rd parties’ business services, such as Office 365. Work or school accounts are usually assigned to end users by their organization (work, school, non-profit) and managed by the admin. However, some business services like Yammer support work or school accounts that were created by end users, without IT involvement. We sometimes refer to these accounts as “viral” AAD accounts but we don’t use this term externally. Work or school accounts are stored in Azure Active Directory (AAD) and managed by Microsoft on behalf of the organization. One of the key difference with a Microsoft account is that users don’t own the account and will typically loose access to it if they leave the organization. Other aspects like password policies are imposed by admins.

The genres channel title for movies.
The studios channel title for movies.
The genres channel title for TV shows.
The networks channel title for TV shows.
The single-language edition of Windows 10 Home.
The evaluation edition of Windows 10 Enterprise.
The Outlook app for sending and receiving email.
The Outlook app for sending and receiving email.
The Outlook app that facilitates the management of events.
The Outlook app that facilitates the management of events.
The quota of words the user can dictate to the phone in a period of 24 hours.
A polished, interactive, web-based canvas created using Sway.
The Sway menu option that automatically suggests content related to a user's current sway and allows him/her to add it.
Long term and less frequent servicing updates for Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 edition.
Long term and less frequent servicing updates for Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 Evaluation edition.
The Sway card that allows users to embed content into their sway from the web.
A button that contains a suggested search term based on what content the user has in his/her sway.
The Sway feature that uses an intelligence platform to suggest color options based on the content in a user’s sway.

descripGrp.descrip: The Sway feature that allows users to make Style- and Structure-based changes to their sway.
The Sway feature that allows users to choose a color and font for their sway.
The Sway panel that provides users with all the Style and Structure options.
The Sway button that provides users with a menu of different style modifications that can be applied to their sway.
A Sway card that takes a set of cards and creates a group out of them with a particular visualization pattern.
The gallery that holds all the Style options that can be applied to a sway.
The option that shows the set of fonts that can be applied to a sway.
The Design feature that allows users to save particular Designs, Styles, or Structures for easy use or access later.
The Structure that places content on a vertical axis and allows users to navigate through it from top to bottom.
The Structure that places content along the horizontal axis and allows users to navigate through it from left and right.
The Sway feature that allows a user to click on content and see it full screen.
The Sway button that allows users to create a bulleted list out of their text.
The Sway button that allows users to create a numbered list out of their text.
The Sway link that opens an email that allows users to report a violation of Sway’s terms of use.
The Sway menu that displays all of the available cards in a single panel.
The Sway button that allows users to create a hyperlink embedded in their sway.
The Outlook folder where archived items are stored.
A design that is derived from another object and that retains ornamental design cues that relate back to the original object.

​An app that assists customers in upgrading from Windows 7 Service Pack 1 (SP1) or Windows 8.1 Update 1 to Windows 10. It notifies them of the option to upgrade, checks their PC for compatibility, and allows them to reserve a free upgrade.

​A website where people can download Microsoft software for recovery (when they own it, but the old copy has been damaged), or first-time installation (when they own the rights, but haven't yet acquired the software itself).

The work area on a computer screen that contains different groups of apps or content open and available for different tasks or aspects of your life. Each group of items is called a desktop or virtual desktop.

The work area on a computer screen that contains different groups of apps or content open and available for different tasks or aspects of your life. Each group of items is called a desktop or virtual desktop.
A tool that checks your computer for infection by specific, prevalent malicious software and helps to remove the infection if it is found.

An action to express that you agree with similar feedback sent by someone else. Rather than resubmit the same feedback, you can tap "Upvote," which means that you agree with the feedback that has been previously submitted.
To agree with similar feedback sent by someone else. Rather than resubmit the same feedback, you can tap "Upvote," which means that you agree with the feedback that has been previously submitted.
The user accounts that are connected as a family. This feature allows adults to manage kids’ experiences within the kids’ user account.
The section in Windows Store containing the user ratings and reviews for a given app.
A view that displays web articles in a distraction-free layout that is optimized for their screen size.
​A prerelease build of Windows 10 for enterprises available to customers in April 2015 or later.
​A prerelease build of Windows 10 made available to customers in April 2015 or later. This is the most basic edition of Windows 10 Insider Preview.
​A prerelease build of Windows 10 for phones that was made available to Insiders.
​The professional edition of Windows 10 Insider Preview released in April 2015 or later.
Any prerelease build of the next version of Windows, made available to customers in Spring 2015 or later.
A set of features that seamlessly adapt and optimize the user interface for different devices, modes of working, hardware, or platforms.

The photo displayed at the top of an album, and used to represent the whole album when albums are shown in list view. It is also used to describe the representative photo in a stack (of near duplicate photos).

The photo displayed at the top of an album, and used to represent the whole album when albums are shown in list view. It is also used to describe the representative photo in a stack (of near duplicate photos).
The "app as a card" capability that retailers purchase from Microsoft and sell to consumers.
An app that can be used to play and record movies and TV shows.
An app that can be used to play and record movies and TV shows.
​A community forum for Windows Insiders.
Any type of unwanted, unsolicited, telephone call. Common types of nuisance calls include prank calls, telemarketing calls, and silent calls.
A keyboard layout in which the onscreen keyboard can be split into two halves, resulting into two halves of the keyboard towards the edge of the screen.
A keyboard layout in which the onscreen keyboard is attached to one edge of the window.
A keyboard layout in which the onscreen keyboard is centered.
A feature that shows multi-tap users how many times they need to tap a key to input a particular character.
A catalog of information for apps, games, movies and TV shows based on dynamic information such as new or fastest rising, top free, best rated, and top paid.
The data from motion sensors which is processed to create information such as step counts or activities (such as walking, running).

A PC-only app that helps users to connect their phone (iOS, Android, or Windows) to their PC, mainly by installing apps on the phone and/or setting up services like OneDrive, Office 365, and Xbox Music.

A PC-only app that helps users to connect their phone (iOS, Android, or Windows) to their PC, mainly by installing apps on the phone and/or setting up services like OneDrive, Office 365, and Xbox Music.
The Camera app that comes pre-installed on high-end Lumia devices.
The Camera app that comes pre-installed on high-end Lumia devices.
A mobile app that helps customers resolve space issues on their phones when installing a new update, by moving apps and files to an SD card or OneDrive, or deleting them.
First-party Windows app for playing commercial and homemade DVD-Video discs.
First-party Windows app for playing commercial and homemade DVD-Video discs.

A variable default lock screen image that shows beautiful images on lock combined with hotspots containing fun facts, Windows tips/trick, and more (similar to Bing IoTD). Users can switch from this default lock screen to a personal picture.
A code used to remove Reset protection without having the Microsoft account credentials that were used to turn it on.
In the Business Store and Education Store, to get apps and other digital goods into the hands of employees or students.
A mode that allows using one app on your mobile screen while using a different app on a second screen that you're projecting from the mobile device.
A feature that lets customers extend their gaming experience across multiple devices, play with other users, and show off scores and achievements.

The default browser in Windows 10, which provides a more interoperable, reliable, and discoverable experience with advanced features including the ability to annotate on web pages, a distraction-free reading experience, and integration of Cortana.

The source location of files that are stored on OneDrive and not synced to the local device. This is different from other OneDrive files (just called "OneDrive"), where a copy is synced and stored locally as well as in the cloud.
Someone on the Business Store with permissions to acquire apps from the Business Store on behalf of their company, but does not have Account settings or Distribute apps permissions.
A view of a set of photos that displays them one at a time, sequentially.
The UI label for network and Internet settings in Windows desktop.
The UI label for network and wireless (mobile) settings in Windows 10 Mobile.
A large, interactive whiteboard device for collaboration and videoconferencing, designed to advance the way people work together naturally.
A large, interactive whiteboard device for collaboration and videoconferencing, designed to advance the way people work together naturally.
A digital pen designed to work with Surface Pro 3 and Surface 3, enabling effortless writing and drawing in any app that supports inking.
The feature which enables printing from a Windows mobile device.
The Music Store subscription-based account.
The area of Windows Store and Microsoft Store where music is sold

A service that provides consumers and businesses with hassle-free Internet access at the most popular Wi-Fi locations around the world, such as hotels chains, airports, conference centers and over 15 million places worldwide.
A hidden utility or app that works in the background to connect Windows features to a 3rd party service.
A hidden utility or app that works in the background to connect Windows features to a 3rd party service.
An appliance-like edition of the OS focused on large screen computing for teams (or groups).
Cellular data that customers can buy from the Windows Store to connect to their Windows device.
A Wi-Fi data or cellular data network that customers can connect to by buying minutes from the Windows Store.
Wi-Fi data that customers can buy from the Windows Store to connect to their Windows device.
An area in the Music app where recently played songs/albums and service-generated mixes are aggregated.
Microsoft Edge developer tool to profile a web page frame rate. This tool helps you see what is happening behind the scenes when your pages are slowing down.
​A device (e.g. phone, tablet, or PC) that runs Windows.
A PC that runs Windows.
A phone that runs Windows 10 Mobile.
A tablet device that runs Windows.
An app to create, print, and scan in 3D.
An app that filters out certain calls and messages from the user's phone, as well as messaging services, with optional blocking of withheld and unknown numbers.
A feature that allows you to bookmark webpages and articles to read later.
The phone capability that lets you place or receive calls.
The UI option on the Start menu to shut down, restart the computer, or put the computer to sleep.
A local area network (LAN) to which mobile users (clients) can connect and communicate by means of high-frequency radio waves rather than wires. WLANs are specified in the IEEE 802.11 standard
A Microsoft paid subscription service (monthly or yearly) that offers streaming and download access to millions of songs in the Groove music catalog.
A win32 desktop application that downloads and flashes the operating system (Windows 10 IoT Core) onto an SD card, and allows users to view data about all active devices on a network.
A plug-in that delivers additional functionality to the Photos app on Windows devices.
A feature in OneNote on Microsoft Surface Hub where you can draw with the Surface Hub pens or with touch.
